name: Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Submit a Construction Pack including a Methodology and JSEA to the Engineer before works
Frequency - Submit 5 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Concrete to be 30Mpa as per DRG-SS-2231 19mm max aggregate . Contractor to provide mix design and strength testing records on request
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Consisting of two parts fine, sharp, well graded sand to one part dry cement.
○ Mix by hand or mixer in small quantities use within 30 minutes
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Reinforcing as per Aurecon Specification
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Hold Down bolts as per pole manufacturers requirements
SECTION 5 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY – LIGHT POLE INSTALLATION
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Centre of Pile set out as per Model coordinates provided.
○ Hold down bolts to be surveyed to essure they align with the location of Light pole bolts.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Reinforcing and embedded items cut, bent (cold) and accurately placed as shown on design drawings. At least 30mm cover to all reinforcing +5mm/-0mm
○ Bar spacing as per Drawings +/-10mm Bend locations as per drawings +/-5mm
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Conduits installed as per NUO requirements and DRG-SS-2231
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Notify Engineer for inspection atleast 24 hours prior to pour
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Concrete shall be high grade with a minimum compressive strength at 28 days of 30 MPa
○ Concrete to be tremied. Vibrating pokers to be used during entire pile length pour.
○ Delivery dockets dated and showing the concrete supplier and design strength shall be collected and held for every pour. Record location and date of each pour.
○ 3 cylinders taken for each pour slump targets as per mix design (1 sample per 75m^3 or each pour)

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Concrete cylinders to achieve minimum target satrenght after 28 days. At the Engineers request site samples/cores for indepentdant testing of fresh or cured concrete to review grading, mix design, strength and thickness.
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Submit a Construction Pack including a Methodology and JSEA to the Engineer before works
Frequency - Submit 5 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre- construction levels where needed.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - pavement subgrade tolerance ; +/-10mm from design subgrade level. Excavation deppth must be at least the design pavement depth for LMC locations. Subgrade shape as per survey set out, to be verified on site

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - The basecourse aggregate shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Quality Index, and California Bearing Ratio.
○ Grading to be compliant with AT 0800 grading specification
Standard/Specification - Aurecon Civil Spec 6.5.2 TNZ M/4
Verifying Document - Material Certificate / QA Sheets
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Blinding to be 10Mpa mix
○ Typical structures - confirm supply of "high strength concrete"; 20MPa concrete; 19mm max aggregate size.
○ As specified on drawing use marine grade concrete 30MPa,
SECTION 5 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY – BUS SHELTER FOUNDATIONS
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Before construction,Contractor to mark out extents of structure
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Conctractor to confirm subgrade strength and report to Engineer via QA inspection
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - 50mm 10Mpa blinding layer to be placed within footpring of structure
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - All concrete shall be batched by weight and mixed in an approved plant requirments of NZS 3104 High grade and Special Grade
○ Concrete for sturtcures to be 30Mpa concrete with slump target as per mix design
Standard/Specification - Aurecon Civil Spec Section 13.6.3, Clause 2.15.5.3.2 of NZS 3104
Verifying Document - Supplier Records Concrete Dockets
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Reinforcement and embedded items cut, bent (cold) and accurately placed as shown on design drawings. At least 30mm cover to all reinforcing +5mm-0mm
○ Bar spacing as per drawings +/- 10 mm Bend locations as per drawings +/-5mm
Verifying Document - Prior to Each pour, QA Checksheet
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Notify Engineer for inspection of formwork 24 hours prior to pour I nspection
Verifying Document - Prior to Each pour, QA Checksheet

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - concrete curing for at least 5 days. Form removal after atleast 12 hours. Post pour inspection to be submmitted for Engineer's acknowlegement showing finished concrete is within tolerances (surface level +/-5 mm)
Standard/Specification - Aurecon Civil Spec Section 10.1.11, NZS 2566.2; Section 6.3.4.1 & 6.3.4.2
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Slump test during pout to check workability of concrete or as directed by Engineer 3 cylinder test taken for each pour. Slump target as per mix design
Verifying Document - Prior to Each pour, QA Checksheet
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - The Engineer's Rep may request site samples/ cores for independent testing of fresh or cured concrete to review the grading, mix design, strength and thickness
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.

Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting. Installation of works under contract compliant and in accordance with all rlevenat regulations, COP and standards unless specified by the engineer
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen.
Acceptance/Conformance criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
